question.questionText: Mary was trying to understand how tuning forks make sounds. She hit the tuning fork on the table and placed the tuning fork into a cup full of water while it was still ringing. The water splashed in all directions. How did seeing what happened help Mary understand how a tuning fork makes sounds?

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: The water splashed because the fork was vibrating. Vibrations make sounds.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Vibration maked all these sound so probably it was vibration.
Because the water splashed because of the vibrations moving.
